sentence.Network_en: The lizard's tongue flicked out and caught a mosquito.
sentence.Network_cn: 蜥蜴突然伸出舌头,捉到一只蚊子.

sentence.Network_en: The lizard's tongue shot out and scooped up the fly.
sentence.Network_cn: 蜥蜴的舌头突然伸出来把苍蝇卷入口中.

sentence.Network_en: The tail keeps wriggling after it leaves the lizard's body.
sentence.Network_cn: 尾巴在离开蜥蜴的身体后不断地扭动.

list.abs: spontaneous removal or casting off of a body part ( as the tail of a lizard or claw or a lobster ) especially when the organism is injured or under attack .自然地除去或抛弃身体的一部分（例如蜥蜴的尾巴或龙虾的脚)。
small long - tailed lizard of arid areas of southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico., 美国西南部和墨西哥西北部干旱地区的小型长尾蜥蜴.
I will not bring you dead mice and lizard tails as presents ., 我不会把死老鼠和壁虎尾巴作为礼物送给您.

means.word_mean: 1. North American herbaceous perennial of wet places having slender curled racemes of small white flowers

auth_sentence.content: Among Flores' inhabitants were the pygmy elephant Stegodon and the Komodo dragon, the world's largest living lizard.
